â¢ [[2001 in science]] *''[[List of years in science|Other Years in Sci Tech]]'' |} == June 30, 2005 == * The launch of the next [[space shuttle]] mission is scheduled for July 13, 2005. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/4639559.stm (BBC)] == June 29, 2005 == * [[NASA]] publishes pictures taken by the [[Cassini spacecraft]] showing a feature that could be a lake of liquid [[methane]] or [[ethane]], close to the southern pole of [[Titan (moon)|Titan]]. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/science/nature/4633043.stm (BBC)] == June 28, 2005 == * The [[Stafford-Covey panel]] reports that 12 of 15 recommendations by the [[Columbia Accident Investigation Board]] (CAIB) were met or exceeded. It also states that the [[Space shuttle|shuttle]] "is a safe vehicle to fly", even though three recommendations were not met. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/science/nature/4629639.stm (BBC)] * Countries backing the [[ITER]] [[nuclear fusion|fusion]] reactor meet in Moscow and decide that the experimental fusion reactor will be built in [[Cadarache]], Southern France. The competing site in Japan will receive compensation. [http://www.physorg.com/news4760.html (PhysOrg)] [http://europa.eu/rapid/pressReleasesAction.do?reference=MEMO/05/226&format=HTML&aged=0&language=EN&guiLanguage=en (European Commission)] [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/science/nature/4629239.stm (BBC)] [http://iht.com/articles/2005/06/28/news/fusion.php (IHT)] == June 22, 2005 == *[[European Space Agency|ESA]] announces that the MARSIS [[radar]] experiment on board the [[Mars Express Orbiter]] is operational. [http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20050622/sc_afp/spaceeuropemars/nc:2117 (YahooNews/AFP)] (Link dead as of 15 January 2007) == June 21, 2005 == *The first specifically designed [[solar sail]] craft, [[Cosmos 1]], a joint private project between [[Planetary Society]], [[Cosmos Studios]] and the [[Russian Academy of Science]], is launched from a Russian submarine. The [[rocket]], however, fails 83 seconds after the launch and the chance of mission failure is "significant". [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/sci/tech/4110912.stm (BBC)] [http://www9.sbs.com.au/theworldnews/region.php?id=114306®ion=3 (SBS)] == June 20, 2005 == *The [[BLAST (telescope)|BLAST]] [[telescope]] lands safely in the [[Canada|Canadian arctic]] after four days of taking data, while held aloft by a [[balloon]]. [http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2005/06/20/tech/main703077.shtml (CBSNews)] == June 18, 2005 == * The supply craft [[Progress spacecraft|Progress]] docks at the [[International Space Station]], after [[cosmonaut]] [[Sergei Krikalev]] takes over control of the spacecraft. [http://www.spaceflightnow.com/news/n0506/18progress18p/ (spaceflightnow)] == June 16, 2005 == * [[European Space Agency|ESA]] announces that the deployment of the second MARSIS boom on the [[Mars Express Orbiter]] was a full success. [http://www.esa.int/esaCP/SEMT1T1DU8E_index_0.html (ESA)] * [[IBM]] and the [[Ãcole polytechnique fÃ©dÃ©rale de Lausanne|Swiss Federal Institute of Technology]] announce that they are working on a computer model of the brain, creating a [[3-D computer graphics|3-D]] [[computer simulation|simulation]] of the [[neocortex]]. [http://money.cnn.com/2005/06/06/technology/ibm_brain.reut/index.htm?section=cnn_tech (CNN Money)] (Link dead as of 15 January 2007) == June 15, 2005 == * The second MARSIS antenna boom of the [[Mars Express Orbiter]] is being deployed. Mission engineers are evaluating the success of this operation. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/science/nature/4096102.stm (BBC)] * The [[space shuttle]] [[Space Shuttle Discovery|Discovery]] returns to the [[launch pad]] in [[Cape Canaveral]] for a planned launch on July 13. [http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20050615/ap_on_sc/space_shuttle (YahooNews/AP)] (Link dead as of 15 January 2007) == June 14, 2005 == * An [[earthquake]] of magnitude 7.0 strikes about 80 miles (130 kilometers) off the coast of northern [[California]] on Tuesday night, briefly prompting a [[tsunami]] warning along the Pacific coast but with no immediate reports of damages or injuries. [http://www.usatoday.com/news/nation/2005-06-14-california-quake_x.htm?csp=24&RM_Exclude=Juno (AP)] == June 13, 2005 == * A 7.9 magnitude [[earthquake]] occurs in the [[Andes mountains]], [[Chile]], killing at least eight persons and injuring several others. [http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20050614/ap_on_re_la_am_ca/chile_quake;_ylt=Avj5b7GYI2xwNMqzre7ReFis0NUE;_ylu=X3oDMTA2NzN0azRvBHNlYwN3bA-- (Yahoo News)] (Link dead as of 15 January 2007) [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/4090388.stm (BBC)] * [[Astronomer]]s announce the discovery of the smallest [[exoplanet]], yet, with about 7.5 times Earth's mass. It orbits the [[star]] [[Gliese 876]], where two [[Jupiter]]-like planets were previously detected. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/science/nature/4089534.stm (BBC)] * [[Red Hat]] releases [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora Core]] 4. [http://news.zdnet.com/2100-3513_22-5744512.html (ZDNet)] ==June 10, 2005== *Dr [[Modadugu Vijay Gupta]] was awarded the [[World Food Prize]] for his development of low-cost fish farming techniques. [http://www.worldfoodprize.org/Laureates/05Laureate/index.htm World Food Prize] == June 9, 2005 == * Tinkerers and innovators have devised a way to link useful data graphically using [[Google Maps]]. Vital information such as crime statistics, gas prices, dark alleyways, housing prices, and potentially much more could be displayed as pinpoints on a Google Map. Efforts to improve the technology are currently underway. [http://www.cnn.com/2005/TECH/internet/06/09/google.map.hacks.ap/index.html (CNN)] (Link dead as of 15 January 2007) * The first Atlantic [[tropical storm]] of the [[2005 Atlantic hurricane season|2005 season]] develops south of [[Cuba]]. [http://www.cnn.com/2005/WEATHER/06/09/tropical.depression.ap/index.html (CNN)] (Link dead as of 15 January 2007) [http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2005/06/09/tech/main700662.shtml (CBSnews)] == June 8, 2005 == * The [[Mars Express Orbiter]] detects an [[Aurora (astronomy)|aurora]] on [[Mars]]. [http://www.spaceflightnow.com/news/n0506/08marsaurora (spaceflightnow)] == June 6, 2005 == * [[Debian|Debian GNU/Linux]]: Version 3.1, codenamed ''sarge'', is released. [http://www.debian.org/News/2005/20050606 (Press release)] * [[Apple Computer]] announces they will change the processors for their [[Apple Macintosh|Macintosh]] computer lineup from [[IBM]] [[PowerPC]]s to [[Intel]]-made CPUs. [http://news.zdnet.com/2100-9584_22-5733756.html?tag=zdfd.newsfeed (Ziff Davis)] [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/4612951.stm (BBC)] == June 4, 2005 == *After 5 weeks of slow progress [[Opportunity Rover|Mars Rover Opportunity]] is freed from the sand dune that it got stuck in April. [http://www.cnn.com/2005/TECH/space/06/05/mars.rover.ap/index.html (CNN)] (Link dead as of 15 January 2007) == June 3, 2005 == *Scientists claim they have sequenced the [[DNA]] of an extinct [[cave bear]]. It was extracted from the remains of animals that died about 40,000 years ago in Austria. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/science/nature/4602739.stm (BBC)] == June 1, 2005 == * A new type of [[sauropod]] has been discovered with a short, stubby neck. Unlike all other known sauropods, whose long necks could get up to four times the length of their backs, ''Brachytrachelopan'''s neck was shorter than its backbone. This species was also unable to lift its neck and head above [[Horizontal plane|horizontal]]. [http://news.nationalgeographic.com/news/2005/06/0601_050601_stubby_dino.html (National Geographic)] *[[Astronomer]]s announce the results of the most detailed [[simulation]] of the evolution of the [[Universe]], using [[supercomputers]], called the [[Millennium Run (cosmology)|Millennium Run]]. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/science/nature/4600981.stm (BBC)] == Past science and technology events by month == [[2005 in science]]: [[February 2005 in science|February]] [[March 2005 in science|March]] [[April 2005 in science|April]] [[May 2005 in science|May]] ''(For earlier science and technology events, see [[January 2005 in science|January 2005]] and preceding months)'' == News collections and sources == See: [[Wikipedia:Current science and technology events sources]]. ==See also== *[[n:Science and technology|Science and technology at Wikinews]] {{DEFAULTSORT:June 2005 In Science}} [[Category:2005 in science|*06]]
